creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: bust of a male figure with narrowed eyes, with a smirk and a large nose, wearing a large hat; ruffles at collar
inscription:
Stamp

in graphite on verso, bottom of sheet: 4 | DTILKSL
markings: stamp on verso, LL: Max Egon Fürst zu Fürstenberg, Lugt 2811
provenance: Max Egon Fürst zu Fürstenberg (1863-1941), Lugt 2811, Donaueschingen (until 1982; sale, Sotheby's, London, no. 415, June 1982. [David Tunick, New York; sold June 1982, to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: The Laughing Peasant
